site.name: BurgerEerst.nl
site.tagline: Citizens first. Security of living, restored.
site.metaDescription: Sign the petition against the current cabinet’s direction: stop benefit cuts, stop rising cost stacking, restore basic security and democratic trust.

home.heroLead: The cabinet’s direction combines cuts and rising costs that hit citizens with the least financial room the hardest. We say: enough is enough.

pillars.title: No benefit cuts
pillars.body: People who cannot work deserve stability — not punishment in euros.

pillars.title: Stop cost stacking
pillars.body: VAT, healthcare, housing and fixed costs can’t keep rising while incomes lag behind.

pillars.title: Fair burden sharing
pillars.body: Stop shifting the bill onto low and middle incomes.

pillars.title: Restore trust
pillars.body: Major decisions must be transparent and backed by public support.

demands: No further cuts to disability/Wajong-like benefits.
Basic security as a hard floor — policy must not push people underwater structurally.
No additional cost increases that disproportionately hit low and middle incomes.
Transparency and real input for policies that directly affect everyday life.
home.notBody: This is not a party campaign and not an attack on any group of people. BurgerEerst.nl is independent and stands for fair debate and humane policy.
home.formLead: After signing you’ll receive an email to confirm your signature (double opt-in).
home.whyLead: Because basic security isn’t a luxury. And policies that hit people with the least room the hardest should never become ‘normal’.

whyCards.title: Basic security under pressure
whyCards.text: Cuts and tighter rules affect people who can’t work. Illness or disability is already hard enough; poverty on top is not an ‘incentive’—it’s harm.

whyCards.title: Costs keep stacking
whyCards.text: VAT, healthcare, housing and groceries rise faster than incomes. If you have no buffer, every policy change hits immediately.

whyCards.title: Housing shortage & capacity
whyCards.text: The housing crisis and pressure on services require realistic choices: faster building, better mobility in the market, and policy guided by capacity.

whyCards.title: Democratic deficit
whyCards.text: Major decisions are too often framed as ‘inevitable’ while citizens carry the consequences. We want transparency, public support and meaningful input.

storyParas: For most people, being unable to work due to illness or disability is not a choice. It’s loss: of routine, prospects, social connection and often pride.
If benefits are then structurally reduced, something avoidable happens: insecurity, stress, and the feeling of being punished for something you didn’t choose.
This petition is for everyone who feels the bill is being shifted onto those with the least room. That’s not fair — and it’s not smart, because it makes problems bigger instead of solving them.
askBullets: No further reductions in benefits for people who are unable to work through no fault of their own.
Protect a hard floor of basic security: essential living costs must remain affordable.
No new cost increases that disproportionately hit low and middle incomes.
Housing and intake policies that match capacity and available homes.
More transparency and public input on decisions that shape everyday life.
home.noteText: This petition targets the government’s course and concrete policies. Our position on NEXIT is on a separate page and is not part of this petition.

vision.title: Vision & principles
vision.lead: BurgerEerst is a citizen initiative. We stand for basic security, fair burdens, and policy that works in real life.

sections.title: 1. People first
paras: Policy should start with everyday life: housing, healthcare, safety and affordability.
If rules or cuts push people into hardship, that’s not ‘tough’ policy — it’s bad design.

sections.title: 2. A fair distribution of burdens
paras: Those with little cannot carry even more. Burdens must be shared fairly and remain workable.
That means: no stacking of cost increases and no poverty used as a policy tool.

sections.title: 3. Housing & capacity
paras: The housing crisis demands speed: building, mobility in the market and clear priorities.
Policy on intake and public services must stay aligned with capacity. Without grip, solidarity erodes.

sections.title: 4. Democracy without shortcuts
paras: Major decisions require explanation, debate and public support — not just press conferences.
We advocate transparency, clear goals and measurable outcomes.

notBullets: Not a political party and not affiliated with any party.
Not a call for hate or exclusion of groups.
Not a single-issue movement: we focus on the connection between basic security, housing and democracy.

nexit.title: NEXIT
nexit.lead: We advocate for a NEXIT: the Netherlands should regain full control over its own course. At the same time, this position is separate from the petition.
body: BurgerEerst.nl does not tie NEXIT to the petition. You can support the petition without agreeing with this page.
We argue for the right to a serious debate on sovereignty, regulation and democratic control — no taboos, but facts, pros/cons and respect.
Any move towards a NEXIT would require careful preparation: impact analysis, scenarios and broad democratic decision-making.
nexit.separateBannerText: The petition on the homepage is about the government’s current course and domestic measures. You can sign the petition without supporting this NEXIT position.

sections.title: Why NEXIT?
paras: The European Union increasingly influences legislation, migration/asylum frameworks, fiscal rules and oversight.
We believe democratic control has moved too far away. If policy fails, the Netherlands must be able to adjust — without endless obligations or compromises.

sections.title: Sovereignty & democracy
paras: Decision-making should remain close to citizens through the national parliament. When core choices are structurally out of reach, a democratic deficit grows.
A NEXIT is, for us, a route to bring responsibility back to the Netherlands: choices, consequences and adjustment in one line.

sections.title: Practical points (what we want to examine/arrange)
bullets: Make Dutch law and border policy leading again, while cooperating where it makes sense.
Continue trade and cooperation through treaties, as many countries do.
A clear transition plan for businesses, workers and regulation.
A fact-based debate including costs, benefits and alternatives.

sections.title: What’s next?
paras: We want this topic to stop being taboo. At minimum: a serious national debate and democratic input on the relationship with the EU.
Not with slogans, but with an actionable plan.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
body: We process minimal personal data: name, city and email to verify your signature.
Your email is used for double opt-in confirmation and is never sold or shared for marketing.
You can request deletion of your data via the contact email.
privacy.lead: We collect as little data as possible and use it only to operate the petition.

sections.title: Why do we collect this?
paras: To register your signature, reduce spam (double opt-in) and show the total number of verified signatures.
We use your email only to send the confirmation email and prevent abuse.

sections.title: Retention
paras: We keep data while the petition is active and as needed to protect the integrity of the count. After that, we delete or anonymize where possible.

sections.title: Sharing with third parties
paras: We never sell your data. We only share with providers necessary to run the site (e.g., email delivery and hosting) under appropriate agreements.

sections.title: Your rights
bullets: File a complaint with the relevant data protection authority

sections.title: Contact
paras: Questions about privacy? Email us via the address listed on the contact page.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
body: BurgerEerst.nl is an independent civic website and is not affiliated with any political party.
The information on this site is meant for public debate and civic participation.
Abuse, hate speech and calls for violence are not allowed.
disclaimer.lead: BurgerEerst.nl is a citizen initiative, not a political party.
